chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
D: cpo
s2: chain D
s1: chain D

Goal:
s1 =p s2 -> lim s1 = lim s2

Premises:
Notation cpo := CPO.type
Notation lim := @CPO.lim
Record chain (T : poset) : Type := Chain { pred_of : Pred T; _ : chain_axiom pred_of } Arguments Chain [T pred_of]
lim_mono : forall (D : cpo) (s1 s2 : chain D), s1 <=p s2 -> lim s1 <== lim s2
Mem_map_inv : ?x \In [seq ?f i | i <- ?s] -> exists y : ?T, ?x = ?f y /\ y \In ?s where ?T : [D : cpo s1 : chain D s2 : chain D |- Type] ?T' : [D : cpo s1 : chain D s2 : chain D |- Type] ?f : [D : cpo s1 : chain D s2 : chain D |- ?T -> ?T'] ?x : [D : cpo s1 : chain D s2 : chain D |- ?T'] ?s : [D : cpo s1 : chain D s2 : chain D |- seq ?T]
chainE : forall (T : poset) (s1 s2 : chain T), s1 = s2 < -> s1 =p s2
supE : forall (T : lattice) (s1 s2 : Pred T), s1 =p s2 -> sup s1 = sup s2
dapp_mono : forall x : ?A, monotone (@^~ x) where ?A : [D : cpo s1 : chain D s2 : chain D |- Type] ?T : [D : cpo s1 : chain D s2 : chain D |- ?A -> poset]
app_mono : forall x : ?A, monotone (@^~ x) where ?A : [D : cpo s1 : chain D s2 : chain D |- Type] ?T : [D : cpo s1 : chain D s2 : chain D |- poset]
sup_clos_mono : forall (T : lattice) (s1 s2 : Pred T), s1 <=p s2 -> sup_closure s1 <=p sup_closure s2
chain_clos_mono : forall (T : cpo) (s1 s2 : Pred T), s1 <=p s2 -> chain_closure s1 <=p chain_closure s2
sup_mono : forall (T : lattice) (s1 s2 : Pred T), s1 <=p s2 -> sup s1 <== sup s2
chain_closI : forall (T : cpo) (s1 s2 : Pred T), chain_closed s1 -> chain_closed s2 -> chain_closed (PredI s1 s2)
In_split : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq_PredType T), x \In s -> exists s1 s2 : seq T, s = s1 ++ x :: s2
lift_chain : forall D : cpo, chain D -> chain D
limP : forall (D : cpo) (s : chain D) (x : D), x \In s -> x <== lim s
sub_limX : forall (D : cpo) (s : Pred D), chain_closed s -> forall u : chain (subPoset s), lim [sval^^ubysval_mono (s:=s)] \In s
limM : forall (D : cpo) (s : chain D) (x : D), (forall y : D, y \In s -> y <== x) -> lim s <== x
cat = fun T : Type => fix cat (s1 s2 : seq T) {struct s1} : seq T := match s1 with | [::] => s2 | x :: s1' => x :: cat s1' s2 end : forall T : Type, seq T -> seq T -> seq T Arguments cat {T}%type_scope (_ _)%seq_scope
chain_closed = fun T : cpo => [Pred s | bot \In s /\ (forall d : chain T, d <=p s -> lim d \In s)] : forall T : cpo, Simpl_Pred (Pred T) Arguments chain_closed {T}
Image_inj_eqmem : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (X1 X2 : Pred A), injective f -> [Image f i | i <- X1] =p [Image f i | i <- X2] -> X1 =p X2
sub_bot : forall (D : cpo) (s : Pred D), chain_closed s -> {x : D | Mem s x}
subp_asym : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> p2 <=p p1 -> p1 =p p2
sup_clos_idemp : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T), sup_closed s -> sup_closure s =p s
chain_clos_idemp : forall (T : cpo) (s : Pred T), chain_closed s -> chain_closure s =p s
Mem_morhp : forall (T : Type) (pT : PredType T) (x y : pT), x <~> y -> x =p y
prop_lim = fun s : chain [posetofProp] => exists p : [posetofProp], p \In s /\ p : chain [posetofProp] -> [posetofProp]
app_chain : forall (A : Type) (T : poset), chain [posetofA -> T] -> A -> chain T
image_chain : forall T1 T2 : poset, chain T1 -> forall f : T1 -> T2, monotone f -> chain T2
ImageEq : forall (A B : Type) (f1 f2 : A -> B) (X : Pred A), f1 =1 f2 -> [Image f1 i | i <- X] =p [Image f2 i | i <- X]
diag_chain : forall T : poset, chain T -> chain (pairPoset T T)
prod_chain : forall (S1 S2 T1 T2 : poset) (f1 : S1 -> T1) (f2 : S2 -> T2), monotone f1 -> monotone f2 -> chain [posetofS1 * S2] -> chain (pairPoset T1 T2)
dapp_chain : forall (A : Type) (T : A -> poset), chain (dfunPoset T) -> forall x : A, chain (T x)
proj2_chain : forall T1 T2 : poset, chain [posetofT1 * T2] -> chain T2
proj1_chain : forall T1 T2 : poset, chain [posetofT1 * T2] -> chain T1
CPO.lim = fun cT : cpo => [eta CPO.mx_lim (CPO.mixin (CPO.class cT))] : forall cT : cpo, chain cT -> cT Arguments CPO.lim {cT}
CPO.mx_lim : forall T : poset, CPO.mixin_of T -> chain T -> T
fun_lim : forall (A : Type) (B : cpo), chain [posetofA -> B] -> [posetofA -> B]
ImageIm : forall (A B C : Type) (f1 : B -> C) (f2 : A -> B) (X : Pred A), [Image f1 i | i <- [Image f2 i | i <- X]] =p [Image (f1 \o f2) i | i <- X]
CPOMixin : forall (T : poset) (mx_bot : T) (mx_lim : chain T -> T), (forall x : T, mx_bot <== x) -> (forall (s : chain T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_lim s) -> (forall (s : chain T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_lim s <== x) -> CPO.mixin_of T
image_chainP : forall (T1 T2 : poset) (s : chain T1) (f : T1 -> T2), monotone f -> chain_axiom [Pred x2 | exists x1 : T1, x2 = f x1 /\ x1 \In s]
const_chain : forall T2 : poset, T2 -> chain T2
lat_lim : forall A : lattice, chain A -> A

``` 
intros D s1 s2 H.
apply chainE in H.
apply supE.
apply lim_mono in H.
exact H.
